title: K3 MStore Online Services Status Page
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Getting Updates For Online Services Getting Updates For Planned Maintenance Downtime You can view the K3 Mstore online services status page here: https://k3mstore.instatus.com/. This will show the current status of our MStore online services, and any planned maintenance that is scheduled in the future. Getting Updates For Online Services You can sign up to receive updates for specific services by clicking on Get Updates and choosing your preferred communication method. From there, you can choose to Get all status update or Only specific components, then choose which service you would like to get updates for and click Subscribe. You will then receive updates via your chosen communication method. We have three websites: shop.myonlinebooking.co.uk, buy.myonlinebooking.co.uk and buy2.myonlinebooking.co.uk, hosted on three respective web servers: SHOP, BUY and BUY2. If you want to know which server you are hosted on, you can have a look in the Base URL field in System Options, Integration within the Back Office (shown below). It's possible that your company have used their own URL, in which case you are likely to be on the SHOP server. Getting Updates For Planned Maintenance Downtime You can also Subscribe to Planned maintenance downtime, to get updates when this finishes. To do this, you need to click Subscribe on the planned maintenance, and choose your preferred communication method. You will then receive updates via your chosen communication method.
description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • Getting Updates For Online Services
  • Getting Updates For Planned Maintenance Downtime


You can view the K3 Mstore online services status page here: https://k3mstore.instatus.com/. This will show the current status of our MStore online services, and any planned maintenance that is scheduled in the future.


Getting Updates For Online Services


You can sign up to receive updates for specific services by clicking on Get Updates and choosing your preferred communication method. 



From there, you can choose to Get all status update or Only specific components, then choose which service you would like to get updates for and click Subscribe. You will then receive updates via your chosen communication method. 



We have three websites: shop.myonlinebooking.co.uk, buy.myonlinebooking.co.uk and buy2.myonlinebooking.co.uk, hosted on three respective web servers: SHOP, BUY and BUY2.


If you want to know which server you are hosted on, you can have a look in the Base URL field in System Options, Integration within the Back Office (shown below). It's possible that your company have used their own URL, in which case you are likely to be on the SHOP server.



Getting Updates For Planned Maintenance Downtime


You can also Subscribe to Planned maintenance downtime, to get updates when this finishes. To do this, you need to click Subscribe on the planned maintenance, and choose your preferred communication method. You will then receive updates via your chosen communication method.

<merge.memberno /> = show the member number

title: Sessions not showing online after x number of days
text: If you have sessions set up more than 40 days in the future, they may not show up online automatically. By default the website will only look up to 40 days in the future (this is due to larger sites, websites running slowly when there are large numbers of sessions configured online) If you have recently had an MStore upgrade this may have been reverted back to 40 days. This value can be modified as required. We can update the value and test, however the more sessions that are loaded the slower the website will load.
description:
If you have sessions set up more than 40 days in the future, they may not show up online automatically. 


By default the website will only look up to 40 days in the future (this is due to larger sites, websites running slowly when there are large numbers of sessions configured online) 


If you have recently had an MStore upgrade this may have been reverted back to 40 days. 


This value can be modified as required. We can update the value and test, however the more sessions that are loaded the slower the website will load.

title: Duplication of tickets on website
text: If you are finding that you have tickets duplicate on the website as below where the description is only shown once and then subsequently with quotation marks: This is down to the fact the website thinks there are multiple different time slots available. When sessions are not used, the system uses the calendar to define which days the PLU can be sold and the time slot to define at which times the tickets are available. In the instance where you have a time slot with multiple times, these will be treated as separate time slots available to book and therefore will result in duplication. By updating the time slot (or creating a new one if used elsewhere) to only have a specific time, this will remove duplication: (Ensure you update the web templates, and refresh the webpage)
description:
If you are finding that you have tickets duplicate on the website as below where the description is only shown once and then subsequently with quotation marks:



This is down to the fact the website thinks there are multiple different time slots available. 


When sessions are not used, the system uses the calendar to define which days the PLU can be sold and the time slot to define at which times the tickets are available. 


In the instance where you have a time slot with multiple times, these will be treated as separate time slots available to book and therefore will result in duplication. 



By updating the time slot (or creating a new one if used elsewhere) to only have a specific time, this will remove duplication:



(Ensure you update the web templates, and refresh the webpage)

title: Re-Sending Booking Confirmation Email
text: If a customer does not receive their booking confirmation email for any reason, you can re-send this email yourself. You can also perform this process to test whether confirmation emails are being sent or not. You will need the online booking reference/online shop order number. This could be found by searching for the booking reference/order number via the customers name with the Back Office. You would also require password to login to your website Back Office portal. Please note: This will only be able to recall online bookings/orders, and always show the items purchased on the website when the booking was created, and will not show any different items if they were added/removed in the Back Office. Once you have this information, you can follow this process: Within the Back Office, Click Setup, Bookings, then Booking Templates. Once Booking Templates is opened, click on Website login. This will take you to your website Back Office portal, where you will need to insert your website Back Office portal password for access. The person at your site who regularly deals with making changes to the website should have this password. If you are unaware who will have this password, please do send a request in via the support portal here. This is not your PIN or password to access the till or MStore Back Office. Once you have gained access to the website Back Office portal, click on Complete Paid Orders. If this options is not showing for you, please report this to support via the support portal here. Here, you can insert the Booking Ref or Order Number in the relevant box, then clicking the relevant Look Up button. When the booking/order is found, you can then type in the email address that you would like the online booking confirmation email to be sent to. Then press Resend Email. We recommend to not use the Send Multiple Email functionality. Depending on sending and receiving emails with yours and the receivers email server, this can take up to half an hour to be received. You may perform this multiple times, if you wish.
description:
If a customer does not receive their booking confirmation email for any reason, you can re-send this email yourself. You can also perform this process to test whether confirmation emails are being sent or not.


You will need the online booking reference/online shop order number.  This could be found by searching for the booking reference/order number via the customers name with the Back Office. You would also require password to login to your website Back Office portal.


Please note: This will only be able to recall online bookings/orders, and always show the items purchased on the website when the booking was created, and will not show any different items if they were added/removed in the Back Office.


Once you have this information, you can follow this process:

  1. Within the Back Office, Click Setup, Bookings, then Booking Templates. 

  2. Once Booking Templates is opened, click on Website login.

  3. This will take you to your website Back Office portal, where you will need to insert your website Back Office portal password for access.

    The person at your site who regularly deals with making changes to the website should have this password. If you are unaware who will have this password, please do send a request in via the support portal here. This is not your PIN or password to access the till or MStore Back Office.


  4. Once you have gained access to the website Back Office portal, click on Complete Paid Orders. If this options is not showing for you, please report this to support via the support portal here.

  5. Here, you can insert the Booking Ref or Order Number in the relevant box, then clicking the relevant Look Up button.

  6. When the booking/order is found, you can then type in the email address that you would like the online booking confirmation email to be sent to. Then press Resend Email. We recommend to not use the Send Multiple Email functionality.

    Depending on sending and receiving emails with yours and the receivers email server, this can take up to half an hour to be received. You may perform this multiple times, if you wish.

title: Mark Online 'Unpaid Reservation' Bookings As Paid
text: If MStore does not receive confirmation of a successful payment for an online booking from your online payment provider, the booking will be marked as an unpaid reservation within the Back Office. However, if you know the payment has gone through, you can manually mark this booking as paid. You will need the online booking reference/online shop order number. This could be found by searching for the booking reference/order number via the customers name with the Back Office. You would also require password to login to your website Back Office portal. Please note: This will only be able to recall online bookings/orders, and always show the items purchased on the website when the booking was created, and will not show any different items if they were added/removed in the Back Office. Once you have this information, you can follow this process: Within the Back Office, Click Setup, Bookings, then Booking Templates. Once Booking Templates is opened, click on Website login. This will take you to your website Back Office portal, where you will need to insert your website Back Office portal password for access. The person at your site who regularly deals with making changes to the website should have this password. If you are unaware who will have this password, please do send a request in via the support portal here. This is not your PIN or password to access the till or MStore Back Office. Once you have gained access to the website Back Office portal, click on Complete Paid Orders. If this options is not showing for you, please report this to support via the support portal here. Here, you can insert the Booking Ref or Order Number in the relevant box, then clicking the relevant Look Up button. When the booking/order is found, with a status of Reserved, you can press Complete, which will send payment successful for the booking in question to the MStore system. This will then display the booking successful web page. This will also send an email to the email address linked to the booking. Depending on sending and receiving emails with yours and the receivers email server, this can take up to half an hour to be received.
description:
If MStore does not receive confirmation of a successful payment for an online booking from your online payment provider, the booking will be marked as an unpaid reservation within the Back Office. However, if you know the payment has gone through, you can manually mark this booking as paid.


You will need the online booking reference/online shop order number.  This could be found by searching for the booking reference/order number via the customers name with the Back Office. You would also require password to login to your website Back Office portal.


Please note: This will only be able to recall online bookings/orders, and always show the items purchased on the website when the booking was created, and will not show any different items if they were added/removed in the Back Office.


Once you have this information, you can follow this process:

  1. Within the Back Office, Click Setup, Bookings, then Booking Templates. 
  2. Once Booking Templates is opened, click on Website login.
  3. This will take you to your website Back Office portal, where you will need to insert your website Back Office portal password for access.

    The person at your site who regularly deals with making changes to the website should have this password. If you are unaware who will have this password, please do send a request in via the support portal here. This is not your PIN or password to access the till or MStore Back Office.
  4. Once you have gained access to the website Back Office portal, click on Complete Paid Orders. If this options is not showing for you, please report this to support via the support portal here.
  5. Here, you can insert the Booking Ref or Order Number in the relevant box, then clicking the relevant Look Up button.
  6. When the booking/order is found, with a status of Reserved, you can press Complete, which will send payment successful for the booking in question to the MStore system.

    This will then display the booking successful web page. This will also send an email to the email address linked to the booking. Depending on sending and receiving emails with yours and the receivers email server, this can take up to half an hour to be received.

title: Amending Your MStore Email Server Details For Online Bookings, Memberships And Shop Orders
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Amending MStore Email Server Details Testing Amending MStore Email Server Details If you need to change your email server details that your MStore website uses to send booking, membership and shop order confirmation emails, you can follow the below process. Within the Back Office, Click Setup, Bookings, then Booking Templates. Once Booking Templates is opened, click on Website login. This will take you to your website Back Office portal, where you will need to insert your website Back Office portal password for access. The person at your site who regularly deals with making changes to the website should have this password. If you are unaware who will have this password, please do send a request in via the support portal here. This is not your PIN or password to access the till or MStore Back Office. Once you have gained access to the website Back Office portal, click on View Config. If this options is not showing for you, please report this to support via the support portal by clicking here. Please use the Change Request category, and Configuration Change for the sub-category. Within the View Config page, you will then need to locate and update each of the below fields to what your email server is set to. You may want to make a backup of the existing settings, just in case you would like to revert these settings back. If you do not see any of these configuration options, please report this to support via the support portal here. EMAILFROMADD - This is the email address used for where configuration emails are sent (via a relay) from. EMAILSERVER - This is the email exchange server used for where configuration emails are sent (via a relay) from the website. EMAILSERVERUID - This is the email exchange user account used for where configuration emails are sent (via a relay) from the website. EMAILSERVERPWD - This is the email exchange server password used for where configuration emails are sent (via a relay) from the website. EMAILSERVERPORT - This is the email exchange server port used for where configuration emails are sent (via a relay) from the website. EMAILSERVERSSL - This is the email exchange server SSL flag used for where configuration emails are sent securely encrypted (via a relay) from the website. Once you have inserted the correct details, scroll to the bottom of the page, and press Update. Testing You may then want to test sending an email to an email address, using these new details. To do this, please follow the below instructions: Click Back to go back to the website Back Office Admin menu. Click on Update Email Templates. Within Update Email Templates, click on Generic Email. Scroll to the bottom of this page. Then click Send Test. Type in a valid email address you would like to send this test email to, and click Send Email. a) If you receive "A confirmation email has been dispatched." at the top of the page, the recipient should then receive this test email within 30 minutes, and the testing is complete. b) If you receive "We're sorry, there has been an error sending your confirmation email please call to confirm booking", there is a problem with your email server details that you will need to double-check, along with the email account. If you require our assistance in troubleshooting the issue with your email server details, you can request this within our support portal by clicking here. Please use the Incident category, and Integration Issue for the sub-category. We will quote you for this work as this will be chargeable.
description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • Amending MStore Email Server Details
  • Testing


Amending MStore Email Server Details


If you need to change your email server details that your MStore website uses to send booking, membership and shop order confirmation emails, you can follow the below process.


  1. Within the Back Office, Click Setup, Bookings, then Booking Templates. 

  2. Once Booking Templates is opened, click on Website login.
  3. This will take you to your website Back Office portal, where you will need to insert your website Back Office portal password for access.

    The person at your site who regularly deals with making changes to the website should have this password. If you are unaware who will have this password, please do send a request in via the support portal here. This is not your PIN or password to access the till or MStore Back Office.


  4. Once you have gained access to the website Back Office portal, click on View Config. If this options is not showing for you, please report this to support via the support portal by clicking here. Please use the Change Request category, and Configuration Change for the sub-category.
  5. Within the View Config page, you will then need to locate and update each of the below fields to what your email server is set to.

    You may want to make a backup of the existing settings, just in case you would like to revert these settings back. If you do not see any of these configuration options, please report this to support via the support portal here.

    • EMAILFROMADD - This is the email address used for where configuration emails are sent (via a relay) from.
    • EMAILSERVER - This is the email exchange server used for where configuration emails are sent (via a relay) from the website.
    • EMAILSERVERUID - This is the email exchange user account used for where configuration emails are sent (via a relay) from the website.
    • EMAILSERVERPWD - This is the email exchange server password used for where configuration emails are sent (via a relay) from the website.
    • EMAILSERVERPORT - This is the email exchange server port used for where configuration emails are sent (via a relay) from the website.
    • EMAILSERVERSSL - This is the email exchange server SSL flag used for where configuration emails are sent securely encrypted (via a relay) from the website.
          

  6. Once you have inserted the correct details, scroll to the bottom of the page, and press Update.


Testing 


You may then want to test sending an email to an email address, using these new details. To do this, please follow the below instructions:

  1. Click Back to go back to the website Back Office Admin menu.

  2. Click on Update Email Templates.
  3. Within Update Email Templates, click on Generic Email.

  4. Scroll to the bottom of this page. Then click Send Test. Type in a valid email address you would like to send this test email to, and click Send Email.


  5. a) If you receive "A confirmation email has been dispatched." at the top of the page, the recipient should then receive this test email within 30 minutes, and the testing is complete.


    b) If you receive "We're sorry, there has been an error sending your confirmation email please call to confirm booking", there is a problem with your email server details that you will need to double-check, along with the email account.

    If you require our assistance in troubleshooting the issue with your email server details, you can request this within our support portal by clicking here. Please use the Incident category, and Integration Issue for the sub-category. We will quote you for this work as this will be chargeable.

title: PLU Upgrade Rules Not Working Online
text: If you previously had PLU Upgrade rules setup online, but they are not firing all of a sudden. You will need to check that all the PLU's linked to your active PLU Upgrade rules have valid prices. If they do not, this can prevent all PLU Upgrade rules from firing. To have a look at this, please follow the below: In the Back Office, go to Setup. Go to PLU Upgrades. Within each PLU upgrade rule, you will need to check there is a valid price on the PLU's for each of the below if they are set: - Qualifying PLU’s Required (This can be accessed by double-clicking on each PLU upgrade rule, to see the list of qualifying PLU’s). - Sell PLU - Renewal Discount PLU Once you are in the PLU Maintenance screen, click Current Pricing, then View/Add Price. Within the Price History, you will be able to see all the PLU's price breaks that has been setup. Make sure there is a valid price for today, and into the future. Finally, you follow this Knowledge Base article to Update Website Templates To Refresh Changes From the Back Office.
description:
If you previously had PLU Upgrade rules setup online, but they are not firing all of a sudden. You will need to check that all the PLU's linked to your active PLU Upgrade rules have valid prices. If they do not, this can prevent all PLU Upgrade rules from firing.


To have a look at this, please follow the below:

  1. In the Back Office, go to Setup.

  2. Go to PLU Upgrades.

  3. Within each PLU upgrade rule, you will need to check there is a valid price on the PLU's for each of the below if they are set:
    - Qualifying PLU’s Required (This can be accessed by double-clicking on each PLU upgrade rule, to see the list of            qualifying PLU’s). 
    - Sell PLU
    - Renewal Discount PLU

     
  4. Once you are in the PLU Maintenance screen, click Current Pricing, then View/Add Price.


  5. Within the Price History, you will be able to see all the PLU's price breaks that has been setup. Make sure there is a valid price for today, and into the future.


  6. Finally, you follow this Knowledge Base article to Update Website Templates To Refresh Changes From the Back Office.

title: Update Website Templates To Refresh Changes From the Back Office
text: If you make changes in the Back Office, and you would like these changes to be sent up to your website, you will need to Update Website Templates. To do this please follow the below steps. Please Note: You will require your website Back Office portal password. Within the Back Office, Click Setup, Bookings, then Booking Templates. Once Booking Templates is opened, click on Website login. This will take you to your website Back Office portal, where you will need to insert your website Back Office portal password for access. The person at your site who regularly deals with making changes to the website should have this password. If you are unaware who will have this password, please do send a request in via the support portal here. This is not your PIN or password to access the till or MStore Back Office. Once you have gained access to your website Back Office portal, you then need to click Update Templates. This will then prompt once this process is complete, which typically takes a couple of seconds. If an error is shown at this point, please report a screenshot of this issue within our support portal here.
description:
If you make changes in the Back Office, and you would like these changes to be sent up to your website, you will need to Update Website Templates.


To do this please follow the below steps. Please Note: You will require your website Back Office portal password.


  1. Within the Back Office, Click Setup, Bookings, then Booking Templates. 
  2. Once Booking Templates is opened, click on Website login.
  3. This will take you to your website Back Office portal, where you will need to insert your website Back Office portal password for access.

    The person at your site who regularly deals with making changes to the website should have this password. If you are unaware who will have this password, please do send a request in via the support portal here. This is not your PIN or password to access the till or MStore Back Office.
  4. Once you have gained access to your website Back Office portal, you then need to click Update Templates. This will then prompt once this process is complete, which typically takes a couple of seconds.

    If an error is shown at this point, please report a screenshot of this issue within our support portal here.

title: Check Access button not working.
text: It was made for a customer around 10 years ago and since this was made it has not been something that we have supported in the last 8 years. It's not something we maintain any longer.
description: It was made for a customer around 10 years ago and since this was made it has not been something that we have supported in the last 8 years. It's not something we maintain any longer.

title: Email Server Settings For Outlook/Microsoft 365 Accounts
text: Please use the below settings if you are setting up an Outlook/Microsoft 365 account for your for online bookings, memberships and shop orders. EMAILFROMADD - This is the email address that will be sending emails from. EMAILSERVER - smtp.office365.com EMAILSERVERUID - This is the username that has access to send emails on behalf of the email address set in EMAILFROMADD - This is usually the same as what is set in EMAILFROMADD. EMAILSERVERPWD - This is the App Password created for the account that has access to send emails on behalf of what is set for EMAILFROMADD. Details of how to create an App Password: https://support.microsoft.com/en-gb/account-billing/manage-app-passwords-for-two-step-verification-d6dc8c6d-4bf7-4851-ad95-6d07799387e9 EMAILSERVERPORT - 587 EMAILSERVERSSL - Yes or ✅
description:
Please use the below settings if you are setting up an Outlook/Microsoft 365 account for your for online bookings, memberships and shop orders.

  • EMAILFROMADD - This is the email address that will be sending emails from.
  • EMAILSERVER - smtp.office365.com
  • EMAILSERVERUID - This is the username that has access to send emails on behalf of the email address set in EMAILFROMADD - This is usually the same as what is set in EMAILFROMADD.
  • EMAILSERVERPWD - This is the App Password created for the account that has access to send emails on behalf of what is set for EMAILFROMADD. Details of how to create an App Password: https://support.microsoft.com/en-gb/account-billing/manage-app-passwords-for-two-step-verification-d6dc8c6d-4bf7-4851-ad95-6d07799387e9
  • EMAILSERVERPORT - 587
  • EMAILSERVERSSL - Yes or ✅

title: Membership Record Not Created When Selling Membership Online
text: If you are selling memberships online via a booking template, and a membership isn't created when purchased, this can be due to the Allow Selling on Internet? on the Membership Types is not ticked. But the booking resource is still available to be sold. Where this will create a booking instead. Once you have updated the relevant Membership Types, don't forget to Update Website Templates To Refresh Changes From the Back Office.
description:
If you are selling memberships online via a booking template, and a membership isn't created when purchased, this can be due to the Allow Selling on Internet? on the Membership Types is not ticked. But the booking resource is still available to be sold. Where this will create a booking instead.


Once you have updated the relevant Membership Types, don't forget to Update Website Templates To Refresh Changes From the Back Office.

title: Booking template set up issue showing blank options.
text: This error below will be because the time slots are not set up correctly. Multiple time slots have been selected for the session rather that one continuous time block leading to the multiple instances with no PLU on them. The solution to this is detailed below to fix the problem.
description:
This error below will be because the time slots are not set up correctly.





Multiple time slots have been selected for the session rather that one continuous time block leading to the multiple instances with no PLU on them. 






The solution to this is detailed below to fix the problem.

title: Same Day Cut Off Time
text: It is possible to set up online tickets so that they cut off at a specific time each day. This configuration option will affect tickets and sessions online (by default sessions will vanish when they start, this can however be modified so they vanish at the end of the session) In the instance where you may want customers to be able to book for the morning but then prevent any sales later in the day a time can be specified where the current days tickets will be hidden from sale. Some sites have this set to 00:01 which then prevents bookings for the current day online. This can be configured within the website configuration. To access go to Booking Templates in back office and select 'Website Login' Login to the website configuration: (Password will have been provided to an administrator on site) Select 'View Config' Scroll through the list and find 'SAMEDAYCUTOFFTIME' (If it doesn't exist it can be added by clicking Add New Field) Put in the time you would like tickets to stop showing online and click Update. Tickets will then no longer show available online for the current day from the time specified.
description:
It is possible to set up online tickets so that they cut off at a specific time each day. 

This configuration option will affect tickets and sessions online (by default sessions will vanish when they start, this can however be modified so they vanish at the end of the session)


In the instance where you may want customers to be able to book for the morning but then prevent any sales later in the day a time can be specified where the current days tickets will be hidden from sale.


Some sites have this set to 00:01 which then prevents bookings for the current day online. 


This can be configured within the website configuration. To access go to Booking Templates in back office and select 'Website Login'



Login to the website configuration:



(Password will have been provided to an administrator on site)



Select 'View Config'



Scroll through the list and find 'SAMEDAYCUTOFFTIME'


(If it doesn't exist it can be added by clicking Add New Field)



Put in the time you would like tickets to stop showing online and click Update. 


Tickets will then no longer show available online for the current day from the time specified.

title: Sessions showing until end of session
text: By default sessions will vanish when they start. It is however possible to change this so that sessions show until the end of the session rather than the beginning of the session. In the case where you have long sessions set up per day and you still want customers to be able to book while the session is active please let the support team know.
description:
By default sessions will vanish when they start. 


It is however possible to change this so that sessions show until the end of the session rather than the beginning of the session. 


In the case where you have long sessions set up per day and you still want customers to be able to book while the session is active please let the support team know.

title: Failed Bookings/Purchases On MStore, But Money Taken From Customers Bank Accounts
text: If you are getting online bookings/purchases, where customers are reporting they did not receive payment confirmation on their booking/purchases or transaction failed is stated, but the money for this had been taken out of the customers bank account, then this is due to our web server not receiving a confirmation that the customer could have successfully paid. The MStore website has to pass customers to your online payment provider to take the payment. The payment is then processed on your payment providers site, and they send us a response containing whether the payment was successful, failed or declined. If payment is taken, but no booking is logged in MStore, our system has not received a response from the payment provider within an appropriate time. There can be any number of reasons for this to occur, including Network errors between the provider and our website Error with the provider PC/Internet browser crashing Power cut Abandoned transactions. Delay in this response being sent to our system. Unfortunately, it is impossible to catch data that we have not received If we do not receive this from your payment provider in 1-2 hours+, this booking will be automatically set to a cancelled reservation, to release the availability for another customer to book. Otherwise most availability would be filled from abandoned transactions of customers selecting tickets, but not successfully paying for them.
description:
If you are getting online bookings/purchases, where customers are reporting they did not receive payment confirmation on their booking/purchases or transaction failed is stated, but the money for this had been taken out of the customers bank account, then this is due to our web server not receiving a confirmation that the customer could have successfully paid.


The MStore website has to pass customers to your online payment provider to take the payment. The payment is then processed on your payment providers site, and they send us a response containing whether the payment was successful, failed or declined.


If payment is taken, but no booking is logged in MStore, our system has not received a response from the payment provider within an appropriate time. There can be any number of reasons for this to occur, including

  • Network errors between the provider and our website
  • Error with the provider
  • PC/Internet browser crashing
  • Power cut
  • Abandoned transactions.
  • Delay in this response being sent to our system.


Unfortunately, it is impossible to catch data that we have not received If we do not receive this from your payment provider in 1-2 hours+, this booking will be automatically set to a cancelled reservation, to release the availability for another customer to book. Otherwise most availability would be filled from abandoned transactions of customers selecting tickets, but not successfully paying for them.

title: Update Website Configuration Options In Your Website Back Office Portal
text: If you make website configuration changes, you will need to access your website Back Office portal. To do this please follow the below steps. Please Note: You will require your website Back Office portal password. Within the Back Office, Click Setup, Bookings, then Booking Templates. Once Booking Templates is opened, click on Website login. This will take you to your website Back Office portal, where you will need to insert your website Back Office portal password for access. The person at your site who regularly deals with making changes to the website should have this password. If you are unaware who will have this password, please do send a request in via the support portal here. This is not your PIN or password to access the till or MStore Back Office. Once you have gained access to your website Back Office portal, you then need to click View Config. This will then give you a list of different configuration settings that you can change.
description:
If you make website configuration changes, you will need to access your website Back Office portal.


To do this please follow the below steps. Please Note: You will require your website Back Office portal password.


  1. Within the Back Office, Click Setup, Bookings, then Booking Templates. 
  2. Once Booking Templates is opened, click on Website login.
  3. This will take you to your website Back Office portal, where you will need to insert your website Back Office portal password for access.

    The person at your site who regularly deals with making changes to the website should have this password. If you are unaware who will have this password, please do send a request in via the support portal here. This is not your PIN or password to access the till or MStore Back Office.
  4. Once you have gained access to your website Back Office portal, you then need to click View Config. This will then give you a list of different configuration settings that you can change.

title: Remove 'This Membership Renewal Qualifies For A Discount' Text On Online Membership Renewal Page
text: If you would like to remove the text 'This membership renewal qualifies For a discount' on the online membership renewal page, then there are two website config options that you will need to update. You will first need to follow Update Website Configuration Options In Your Website Back Office Portal to get to the configuration page. Once you are here, you will need to set the two website configuration settings, in bold below, to 0. RENEWALXDAYSBEFORE - Default is 90. Number of days before the expiry of a membership that a renewal discount can be provided. RENEWALXDAYSAFTER - Default is 0. Number of days after the expiry of a membership that a renewal discount can be provided. Most Internet browsers allow you to search for text on a page, to make this easier to find. To do this, press Ctrl + F. You can then type in the phrase you are looking for in the box that appears. These options may not always be together. If you still cannot find this option, please do send a request in via the support portal here. Support can then add these configuration settings to your configuration page.
description:
If you would like to remove the text 'This membership renewal qualifies For a discount' on the online membership renewal page, then there are two website config options that you will need to update.


You will first need to follow Update Website Configuration Options In Your Website Back Office Portal to get to the configuration page. Once you are here, you will need to set the two website configuration settings, in bold below, to 0.


  • RENEWALXDAYSBEFORE - Default is 90. Number of days before the expiry of a membership that a renewal discount can be provided.  
  • RENEWALXDAYSAFTER - Default is 0. Number of days after the expiry of a membership that a renewal discount can be provided.



Most Internet browsers allow you to search for text on a page, to make this easier to find. To do this, press Ctrl + F. You can then type in the phrase you are looking for in the box that appears. These options may not always be together.


If you still cannot find this option, please do send a request in via the support portal here. Support can then add these configuration settings to your configuration page.

title: Email template image not filling header
text: If you have an issue where the header image is not filling all the assigned space, it will give a white line under the image as it doesn't fill the entire space. To resolve: Add the below code to the email template: Add style to the very top of the page and add the class = logo-img to the cell containing the logo merge tag. td.logo-img img { min-width: 100% !important }
description:
If you have an issue where the header image is not filling all the assigned space, it will give a white line under the image as it doesn't fill the entire space. 


To resolve: 


Add the below code to the email template:


Add style to the very top of the page and add the class = logo-img to the cell containing the logo merge tag. 


<style> td.logo-img img { min-width: 100% !important } </style> 

<td align="center" class="logo-img"><merge.logoimg /></td></tr>

title: Online payment received late - Booking status not updated
text: Mstore expects a payment response to be received back from the payment provider within an hour window. The reason for this is down to online availability. This can be extended by request however this will then have a knock on effect on any session / ticket availability as the system will not clear down the reserved bookings after an hour. While the system is waiting on a payment response any bookings created will be placed into a 'reserved' status. After an hour the system will then automatically mark the booking as 'Cancelled'. If a payment is received after this point the booking will NOT be updated automatically and will require the booking status to be updated manually. Troubleshooting: Once a payment request has been sent to the payment provider K3 no longer have any control over the transaction. The system will wait for a payment response. If there are any problems encountered payment provider end this will need to be taken up with your payment provider. Most payment providers have an online portal to track payments, this will also show any pending payments.
description:
Mstore expects a payment response to be received back from the payment provider within an hour window. 


The reason for this is down to online availability. This can be extended by request however this will then have a knock on effect on any session / ticket availability as the system will not clear down the reserved bookings after an hour. 


While the system is waiting on a payment response any bookings created will be placed into a 'reserved' status. 


After an hour the system will then automatically mark the booking as 'Cancelled'. 


If a payment is received after this point the booking will NOT be updated automatically and will require the booking status to be updated manually. 


Troubleshooting:


Once a payment request has been sent to the payment provider K3 no longer have any control over the transaction. The system will wait for a payment response. If there are any problems encountered payment provider end this will need to be taken up with your payment provider. 


Most payment providers have an online portal to track payments, this will also show any pending payments.

title: Membership photos online not displaying in back office
text: If you use membership photos online and they are not pulling through to back office this will most likely be down to the fact that the K3 Image Transfer Service has stopped server side. This service pulls the saved photos from the website over to the application server where they can be accessed by the back office software. Troubleshooting: Log into your database server (If you don't have access please contact your IT team) You will find a service called K3 MemberPhoto Transfer Service: If this is stopped, please give it a restart. If this is running will still be worth giving the service a restart. ------------------ If this doesn't resolve the problem please contact the support team who can investigate further.
description:
If you use membership photos online and they are not pulling through to back office this will most likely be down to the fact that the K3 Image Transfer Service has stopped server side. 


This service pulls the saved photos from the website over to the application server where they can be accessed by the back office software. 


Troubleshooting:


Log into your database server (If you don't have access please contact your IT team)


You will find a service called K3 MemberPhoto Transfer Service:




If this is stopped, please give it a restart. If this is running will still be worth giving the service a restart. 


------------------


If this doesn't resolve the problem please contact the support team who can investigate further.

title: Data capture online
text: Data captures can be set up online in the same way as in house data captures, however the website does not take into account what option is selected within back office and will always prompt per sales line: This is down to how the online system stores the data. (Development have confirmed that additional wording will be added to future versions to make this clear as it's not currently clear that this is how it works. Version 3.18.4 onwards)
description:
Data captures can be set up online in the same way as in house data captures, however the website does not take into account what option is selected within back office and will always prompt per sales line:




This is down to how the online system stores the data. 


(Development have confirmed that additional wording will be added to future versions to make this clear as it's not currently clear that this is how it works. Version 3.18.4 onwards)

title: Booking Confirmation Email Template Custom Header Image Reverting
text: Issue If you are experiencing where your booking confirmation email custom header image keeps reverting to another image, this can be due to the way the system is setup to work. When you upload a new image to a booking confirmation email template, the system saves this image, and then the booking confirmation email template references this image via its name. If you then upload a different image with the same name, this image won't be saved as the original image cannot be overwritten. So the original image will continue to show when you view the page again. Solution To overcome this, we recommend to give each new booking confirmation email template custom header image a different name to prevent this from occurring.
description:
Issue

If you are experiencing where your booking confirmation email custom header image keeps reverting to another image, this can be due to the way the system is setup to work.


When you upload a new image to a booking confirmation email template, the system saves this image, and then the booking confirmation email template references this image via its name.


If you then upload a different image with the same name, this image won't be saved as the original image cannot be overwritten. So the original image will continue to show when you view the page again.


Solution

To overcome this, we recommend to give each new booking confirmation email template custom header image a different  name to prevent this from occurring.

title: Discounting PLU Group Items Online With Internet Voucher
text: If you would like to discount PLU Group items on your website, you will need to setup an Internet Voucher that is Basket Reducing, with a Refund Resource set. This will add a separate line in the basket when recalling the booking, that involves the discount. This is because when the PLU Group item is recalled on the till, the price will always be recalculated to the value of the Group PLU's, even if the PLU was discounted online. However, this will discount the whole online basket, whether by percentage or value of reduction. The Basket Reducing and Refund Resource can be found in the below two places: Internet Voucher/Coupons Screen Within the Back Office. Discount Vouchers within the Online Back Office Portal. Once this Internet Voucher has been setup, and used online, recalling a booking that has this applied, you can see there is a separate promotion discount line in the basket.
description:
If you would like to discount PLU Group items on your website, you will need to setup an Internet Voucher that is Basket Reducing, with a Refund Resource set. This will add a separate line in the basket when recalling the booking, that involves the discount.

This is because when the PLU Group item is recalled on the till, the price will always be recalculated to the value of the Group PLU's, even if the PLU was discounted online. However, this will discount the whole online basket, whether by percentage or value of reduction.

The Basket Reducing and Refund Resource can be found in the below two places:


Internet Voucher/Coupons Screen Within the Back Office.
 


Discount Vouchers within the Online Back Office Portal.



Once this Internet Voucher has been setup, and used online, recalling a booking that has this applied, you can see there is a separate promotion discount line in the basket.

title: Adding Sub Headers to Booking Templates
text: It is possible to add sub headers into booking headers as below: To add a header record. Create a new PLU called something like 'HEADER' and set with a zero price: Create a new bookable resource and set the description to be #Header=NAMEHERE# The text within the hash will show online. Ensure that the PLU has a valid price and the calendar period is valid as with the other items on the template. Re-create the online templates and any headers you have added will show online.
description:
It is possible to add sub headers into booking headers as below:



To add a header record. 


Create a new PLU called something like 'HEADER' and set with a zero price:



Create a new bookable resource and set the description to be #Header=NAMEHERE#



The text within the hash will show online. 


Ensure that the PLU has a valid price and the calendar period is valid as with the other items on the template. 


Re-create the online templates and any headers you have added will show online.

title: MStore and ReCaptcha
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS What is a CAPTCHA? MStore Ticketing and ReCaptcha A Note About Gateways What is a CAPTCHA? A CAPTCHA test is designed to determine if an online user is really a human and not a bot. CAPTCHA is an acronym that stands for "Completely Automated Public Turing test to tell Computers and Humans Apart." Users often encounter CAPTCHA and reCAPTCHA tests on the Internet when submitting contact forms, logins and checkouts, to ensure the person submitting the form is a real person. Such tests are one way of managing bot activity, although the approach has its drawbacks. Although CAPTCHAs are designed to block automated bots, CAPTCHAs are themselves automated. They're programmed to pop up in certain places on a website, and they automatically pass or fail users. CAPTCHAs can be user interactive or fully automated. Fully automated/invisible CAPTCHAs use the providers intelligence to determine if the entity browsing a page is real. it bases this on IP address, browser type, and various other HTTP header type of information. This, along with taking a holistic look at a user's behaviour and history of interacting with content on the Internet helps to determine the likelihood of being a bot. Most of the time, the program can decide based on those factors whether or not the user is a bot, without providing the user with a challenge to complete. If not, then the user will get a typical reCAPTCHA challenge. Some examples of a visible CAPTCHA are below. Note: Bots themselves are not necessarily harmful. Google and other search engines use bots to trawl web pages for search purposes. However, not all bots are as pleasant and some are used for nefarious purposes ReCaptcha is a free service offered by Google to allow websites to utilise a CAPTCHA on their own websites, and does require code implementation at the point a site wants to check the authenticity of a user. CAPTCHAs are not foolproof. They are simply one way of helping to reduce the risk of bot attacks. Several hundreds of thousands of pounds can be spent on cybersecurity and bots can still get around it. So it is a rick/reward scenario when considering the use of a CAPTCHA. MStore Ticketing and ReCaptcha We have added support for Google ReCaptcha's Invisible captcha into our core product for new websites, but does require implementation on to existing sites, and will require a conversation with your success manager for this to be enabled. Our ReCaptcha implementation is designed to check the authenticity of the user immediately before forwarding them to the payment gateway. It happens when the user clicks on the Pay Now button. This is designed to reduce the bot traffic to any potential payment gateway. Our implementation allows you to fine tune how "aggressive" the ReCaptcha is in deciding if a transaction is a human or bot as shown below. The setting is highlighted below in the website config which you can access on your online portal. Note that the GoogleCaptchaSilentMode allows activity logging to be done without actually having any Captcha process stop/allow transactions. If the CAPTCHA check fails, they do not reach the payment gateway. There will be a visible indicator on this page to tell them it has failed, and it is impossible for a failed CAPTCHA to reach the Gateway. Some human interaction may be interpreted by Google's ReCaptcha due to settings the user has on cookies, using Incognito mode etc A Note About Gateways Payment gateways typically utilise their own threat detection systems, including CAPTCHA systems. If the user is getting a CAPTCHA fail on the Payment Gateway, it is not something we can manage or control.
description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • What is a CAPTCHA?
  • MStore Ticketing and ReCaptcha
  • A Note About Gateways


What is a CAPTCHA?


A CAPTCHA test is designed to determine if an online user is really a human and not a bot. CAPTCHA is an acronym that stands for "Completely Automated Public Turing test to tell Computers and Humans Apart." Users often encounter CAPTCHA and reCAPTCHA tests on the Internet when submitting contact forms, logins and checkouts, to ensure the person submitting the form is a real person. Such tests are one way of managing bot activity, although the approach has its drawbacks.


Although CAPTCHAs are designed to block automated bots, CAPTCHAs are themselves automated. They're programmed to pop up in certain places on a website, and they automatically pass or fail users.


CAPTCHAs can be user interactive or fully automated. Fully automated/invisible CAPTCHAs use the providers intelligence to determine if the entity browsing a page is real. it bases this on IP address, browser type, and various other HTTP header type of information. This, along with taking a holistic look at a user's behaviour and history of interacting with content on the Internet helps to determine the likelihood of being a bot. Most of the time, the program can decide based on those factors whether or not the user is a bot, without providing the user with a challenge to complete. If not, then the user will get a typical reCAPTCHA challenge. 


Some examples of a visible CAPTCHA are below.


Note:  Bots themselves are not necessarily harmful. Google and other search engines use bots to trawl web pages for search purposes. However, not all bots are as pleasant and some are used for nefarious purposes


ReCaptcha is a free service offered by Google to allow websites to utilise a CAPTCHA on their own websites, and does require code implementation at the point a site wants to check the authenticity of a user.


CAPTCHAs are not foolproof. They are simply one way of helping to reduce the risk of bot attacks. Several hundreds of thousands of pounds can be spent on cybersecurity and bots can still get around it. So it is a rick/reward scenario when considering the use of a CAPTCHA.


MStore Ticketing and ReCaptcha

We have added support for Google ReCaptcha's Invisible captcha into our core product for new websites, but does require implementation on to existing sites, and will require a conversation with your success manager for this to be enabled.


Our ReCaptcha implementation is designed to check the authenticity of the user immediately before forwarding them to the payment gateway. It happens when the user clicks on the Pay Now button. This is designed to reduce the bot traffic to any potential payment gateway.


Our implementation allows you to fine tune how "aggressive" the ReCaptcha is in deciding if a transaction is a human or bot as shown below. The setting is highlighted below in the website config which you can access on your online portal.




Note that the GoogleCaptchaSilentMode allows activity logging to be done without actually having any Captcha process stop/allow transactions.



If the CAPTCHA check fails, they do not reach the payment gateway. There will be a visible indicator on this page to tell them it has failed, and it is impossible for a failed CAPTCHA to reach the Gateway.


Some human interaction may be interpreted by Google's ReCaptcha due to settings the user has on cookies, using Incognito mode etc



A Note About Gateways

Payment gateways typically utilise their own threat detection systems, including CAPTCHA systems.


If the user is getting a CAPTCHA fail on the Payment Gateway, it is not something we can manage or control.

title: Useful Website Configuration Options Regarding Membership Card Uses Online
text: If you use the membership card validation functionality for online purchases, you may want to be aware of the below website configuration options, that will determine the behaviour of how often membership cards can be used. MEMCARDVALIDDAYS - The same membership card can’t be used on another transaction on the for this amount of days. Default is 100. MEMCARDALLOWREUSE - Allow the same membership number to be validated against multiple items on the basket page. If you cannot see these options in your website configuration options, please contact K3 Support to add these in for you.
description:
If you use the membership card validation functionality for online purchases, you may want to be aware of the below website configuration options, that will determine the behaviour of how often membership cards can be used.

 

MEMCARDVALIDDAYS - The same membership card can’t be used on another transaction on the  for this amount of days. Default is 100.

 

MEMCARDALLOWREUSE -  Allow the same membership number to be validated against multiple items on the basket page.



If you cannot see these options in your website configuration options, please contact K3 Support to add these in for you.

title: How does styling work for the Ticketing pages?
text: Historically, when K3 have developed customer ticketing sites to be inline with the customer's general website, we have referenced the customer's own Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) files, hosted on their own servers. This brought benefits such as customers being able to control their stylesheets, which will downstream to our ticketing site... B U T The K3 ticketing site depends on certain CSS content being in a certain format, which means that customers can, inadvertently, break their ticketing site when making changes to their main website. This causes a huge amount of pain for all involved with potential loss of ticketing revenue for K3's customers, and recently these issues have become more frequent. Policy to eliminate ticketing downtime from website styling changes K3 will host a copy of the customer's CSS on our site (as well as customers hosting their own copy on their main website) Impact The ticketing website will not be broken by main website styling changes. Any changes customers want to do to their own website will need to be sent to K3 to be applied to the ticketing site as well This means that, if customers want to make changes to their website styling, you will need to raise a change request through your CSM or Support. We will take a copy of your CSS, apply it, test it, and deploy it with your signoff. This will be a small chargeable consulting project. This policy change will be rolled out as and when required unless you would like to request it's done now. If any of the following apply, this is the point when we will switch from referring to the main website CSS to hosting a copy on the ticketing website: Website Reskin. Mini website reskin where navigation and or simple styling changes are done. Upgrading website technology (to the newer "bootstrap" version). This is a simple, proactive solution to prevent ticket purchases being unavailable due to an unexpected change to the main website styling.
description:
Historically, when K3 have developed customer ticketing sites to be inline with the customer's general website, we have referenced the customer's own Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) files, hosted on their own servers. This brought benefits such as customers being able to control their stylesheets, which will downstream to our ticketing site...



 B U T


The K3 ticketing site depends on certain CSS content being in a certain format, which means that customers can, inadvertently, break their ticketing site when making changes to their main website. This causes a huge amount of pain for all involved with potential loss of ticketing revenue for K3's customers, and recently these issues have become more frequent.


Policy to eliminate ticketing downtime from website styling changes
K3 will host a copy of the customer's CSS on our site (as well as customers hosting their own copy on their main website)

Impact
The ticketing website will not be broken by main website styling changes.
Any changes customers want to do to their own website will need to be sent to K3 to be applied to the ticketing site as well



This means that, if customers want to make changes to their website styling, you will need to raise a change request through your CSM or Support. We will take a copy of your CSS, apply it, test it, and deploy it with your signoff. This will be a small chargeable consulting project.


This policy change will be rolled out as and when required unless you would like to request it's done now. If any of the following apply, this is the point when we will switch from referring to the main website CSS to hosting a copy on the ticketing website:

  1. Website Reskin.
  2. Mini website reskin where navigation and or simple styling changes are done. 
  3. Upgrading website technology (to the newer "bootstrap" version).

 

This is a simple, proactive solution to prevent ticket purchases being unavailable due to an unexpected change to the main website styling.

title: Network Requirements For MStore Website Hosting
text: If you use MStore to host your ticketing, membership and/or webshop websites, then you will need to make sure the below requirements are in place to make sure our web servers can access the MStore database if this is hosted on a customers server. You will need to setup a port forwarding rule on your local network, to have port 22221 forward to the local IP address of your server where the MStore database and API we would have setup is located. If your network requires to whitelist external IP addresses, please whitelist the below IP's: 109.228.28.169 109.228.46.91 109.228.56.35 109.228.58.205 109.228.59.148
description:
If you use MStore to host your ticketing, membership and/or webshop websites, then you will need to make sure the below requirements are in place to make sure our web servers can access the MStore database if this is hosted on a customers server.


You will need to setup a port forwarding rule on your local network, to have port 22221 forward to the local IP address of your server where the MStore database and API we would have setup is located.


If your network requires to whitelist external IP addresses, please whitelist the below IP's:

  • 109.228.28.169
  • 109.228.46.91
  • 109.228.56.35
  • 109.228.58.205
  • 109.228.59.148

title: Moving a booking removes the Online Discount
text: If you modify an online booking that initially included an online discount whether by changing the date or simply adjusting the time the back-office system, the system will then reference internal pricing rather than the original online pricing when processing the update. You would have to then override the price to re-apply the original discount.
description:
If you modify an online booking that initially included an online discount whether by changing the date or simply adjusting the time the back-office system, the system will then reference internal pricing rather than the original online pricing when processing the update.


You would have to then override the price to re-apply the original discount.

title: Confirmation Emails 'Re-Using' A Reference From The Past
text: If you have noticed a confirmation email referencing a reference number from the past, this is likely that you are looking at two different parts of the system. Bookings Bookings usually state Booking Reference before the reference number. These are which are usually sessions, admission ticket and experiences. Sales Orders Sales orders usually state Order Reference before the reference number. These are generally when a customer has bought something tangible, like a shop item, gift card (which can be for the recipient to booking an experience), adoption or membership.
description:
If you have noticed a confirmation email referencing a reference number from the past, this is likely that you are looking at two different parts of the system.


Bookings

Bookings usually state Booking Reference before the reference number. These are which are usually sessions, admission ticket and experiences.


Sales Orders

Sales orders usually state Order Reference before the reference number. These are generally when a customer has bought something tangible, like a shop item, gift card (which can be for the recipient to booking an experience), adoption or membership.

title: How To Upload Images For Shop Items
text: Please note: If you have never used this functionality before, this may need to be setup for your site, which might be chargeable if you do not have the required modules. How do I upload images to my shop website? If you would like to upload images for a shop item, open the PLU maintenance screen for this record, make sure Sell item on the Internet? (1) is ticked. Then click on Product Images (2). Here you can add the Category image and up to 4 different images for the item. You can navigate to each image by clicking on each tab (3) that runs at the top of the Images window. To add an image, click the three ... (4) and select the image that you have saved on your PC, then click Open and Ok (5) to upload this to the Back Office and website. You will then need to log into your online website portal to Update Images & Data to upload these images to your website. How long will it take for my images to be uploaded to the website? This process can take matter of minutes, to a maximum of 20 minutes on rare occasions. This is because there is a process that runs on a regular basis. As soon as you press 'Upload Images & Data', this flags for your website to retrieve any new shop images when the next time this process is run. Once the image has been uploaded, this will be available to show on the website immediately. What image file formats can I use? You can use common image file formats like .jpg and .png file. What size images can I use? The maximum image size in pixels is 300x300px.
description:
Please note: If you have never used this functionality before, this may need to be setup for your site, which might be chargeable if you do not have the required modules. 


How do I upload images to my shop website?

If you would like to upload images for a shop item, open the PLU maintenance screen for this record, make sure Sell item on the Internet? (1) is ticked.


Then click on Product Images (2). Here you can add the Category image and up to 4 different images for the item. You can navigate to each image by clicking on each tab (3) that runs at the top of the Images window.


To add an image, click the three ... (4) and select the image that you have saved on your PC, then click Open and Ok (5) to upload this to the Back Office and website.



You will then need to log into your online website portal to Update Images & Data to upload these images to your website. 


How long will it take for my images to be uploaded to the website?

This process can take matter of minutes, to a maximum of 20 minutes on rare occasions. This is because there is a process that runs on a regular basis. As soon as you press 'Upload Images & Data', this flags for your website to retrieve any new shop images when the next time this process is run.


Once the image has been uploaded, this will be available to show on the website immediately.


What image file formats can I use?

You can use common image file formats like .jpg and .png file.


What size images can I use?

The maximum image size in pixels is 300x300px.

title: Update Online Shop Images & Data To Refresh Changes From the Back Office
text: If you make changes and add new images to online shop items in the Back Office, and you would like these changes to be sent up to your website, you will need to Update Image & Data. To do this please follow the below steps. Please Note: You will require your website Back Office portal password. Within the Back Office, Click Setup, Bookings, then Booking Templates. Once Booking Templates is opened, click on Website login. This will take you to your website Back Office portal, where you will need to insert your website Back Office portal password for access. The person at your site who regularly deals with making changes to the website should have this password. If you are unaware who will have this password, please do send a request in via the support portal here. This is not your PIN or password to access the till or MStore Back Office. Once you have gained access to your website Back Office portal, you then need to click Update Images & Data. This will then prompt once this process is complete, which typically takes a couple of seconds. If an error is shown at this point, please report a screenshot of this issue within our support portal here. For further information, please see How To Upload Images For Shop And Membership Items
description:
If you make changes and add new images to online shop items in the Back Office, and you would like these changes to be sent up to your website, you will need to Update Image & Data.


To do this please follow the below steps. Please Note: You will require your website Back Office portal password.


  1. Within the Back Office, Click Setup, Bookings, then Booking Templates. 
  2. Once Booking Templates is opened, click on Website login.
  3. This will take you to your website Back Office portal, where you will need to insert your website Back Office portal password for access.

    The person at your site who regularly deals with making changes to the website should have this password. If you are unaware who will have this password, please do send a request in via the support portal here. This is not your PIN or password to access the till or MStore Back Office.
  4. Once you have gained access to your website Back Office portal, you then need to click Update Images & Data. This will then prompt once this process is complete, which typically takes a couple of seconds.
    If an error is shown at this point, please report a screenshot of this issue within our support portal here. 
For further information, please see How To Upload Images For Shop And Membership Items

title: Online shop missing items
text: Online shop missing items This article deals with issues where items are not showing on the Web Shop. This could include missing items, out of data prices or details. The Web Shop updates overnight. However, if there is an error and this process is interrupted, the above issue may occur. This should rectify itself overnight with the next update. However, it is possible to force this update in Mstore Back Office. To do this go into templates and select Website Login Update Images and data. This should update all items and associated data to the website.
description:
Online shop missing items


This article deals with issues where items are not showing on the Web Shop.

This could include missing items, out of data prices or details.


The Web Shop updates overnight.

However, if there is an error and this process is interrupted, the above issue may occur.



This should rectify itself overnight with the next update.

However, it is possible to force this update in Mstore Back Office.


To do this go into templates and select Website Login



Update Images and data.

This should update all items and associated data to the website.

title: How MStore Handles Abandoned Baskets For Online Bookings
text: This Knowledge Base article will explain how the system deals with online abandoned baskets, to prevent booking/session allocation being held by these bookings, to be available for willing customers. At the time the customer the customer has inserted all their booking details and click Pay Now, all their bookings details gets sent to your MStore database, saved as an online reservation, awaiting confirmation on a successful payment from your online payment provider. However, we have no control once we pass the customer to your online payment provider and may never receive a confirmation from your online payment provider if the customer does not proceed with payment. Therefore, there has to be a set period of time before changing the customers booking to a cancelled reservation. Our system runs a process to cancel any online booking older than an hour (default) without payment confirmation, which can be adjusted. This is run every hour, which can mean bookings may not cancel until between 60-120 minutes after clicking Pay Now. This is a reasonable amount of time to give customers time to pay for their booking (as they may need to find and attempt paying with multiple cards), without receiving payments after the booking has been cancelled, which must be avoided at all costs. This is because this will not resurrect the customers booking, and all seats the customer booked will be available again, potentially making a customer customer believe of having a booking, when they do not. Some payment providers give customers 20 minutes to pay once customers are passed to their portal. So you may have some customisation at the online payment providers end to help with issues relating to this.
description:
This Knowledge Base article will explain how the system deals with online abandoned baskets, to prevent booking/session allocation being held by these bookings, to be available for willing customers.


At the time the customer the customer has inserted all their booking details and click Pay Now, all their bookings details gets sent to your MStore database, saved as an online reservation, awaiting confirmation on a successful payment from your online payment provider. However, we have no control once we pass the customer to your online payment provider and may never receive a confirmation from your online payment provider if the customer does not proceed with payment.


Therefore, there has to be a set period of time before changing the customers booking to a cancelled reservation. Our system runs a process to cancel any online booking older than an hour (default) without payment confirmation, which can be adjusted. This is run every hour, which can mean bookings may not cancel until between 60-120 minutes after clicking Pay Now.


This is a reasonable amount of time to give customers time to pay for their booking (as they may need to find and attempt paying with multiple cards), without receiving payments after the booking has been cancelled, which must be avoided at all costs. This is because this will not resurrect the customers booking, and all seats the customer booked will be available again, potentially making a customer customer believe of having a booking, when they do not.


Some payment providers give customers 20 minutes to pay once customers are passed to their portal. So you may have some customisation at the online payment providers end to help with issues relating to this.
